column4: hey guys got big probs here. ive just bene upgrading from 6.06 to 6.10. to main upgrade downloaded and installed. i then did installed further updates, while they were installing the screensaver activated, but i tried to log in and it wouldnt accept my password. eventually i decided to reboot, when i boot into linux all i get now is a black screen and cursor at the top. HELP! :x
i cant remember how to activate that, pls remidn me
on boot u enter maintenance mode!
and then u run apt-get update
ok so try recovery mode, then apt-get update
u said u was doing update of your programs after u finished update 2 6.10?
then u enter maintenance mod and type sudo apt-get update

yes. the main 718mb update downloaded. i also had updates available from the update alert synaptic pop-up, but there was a list of updates that were skipped, it then suggested i do sudo apt-get dist-upgrade again, which i did, and thats when the problem occured
but wont it ask for my password again when i do sudo apt-get update ?
just enter terminal mode and type sudo apt-get update or if that doesn't work type sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
yes but u know your password right?

i tried recovery mode, after it scrolls thru line sof code, it eventually says Begin: waiting for root file system ... then nothing happens :P i may as well just download the 6.10 cd and do a fresh install :P
that would be best! sorry but i don't know other solutions for your problem!
luckily i wont lose any important data. im just using ubuntu experiment/experience linux as an alternative to windows :)
